item.title: My old UNIX C runescape server framework
item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:2, topic:294753”]I wrote an RSC server with this guy named Henry.Jekyll or OneWhoSighs :[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2009, 08:09:01 pm[/size][hr]BTW, http://beej.us/guide/bgnet/examples/selectserver.c I looked at that code when I wrote my server as well :|[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2009, 08:12:07 pm[/size][hr]BTW 2: Why do you dereference a pointer each time you want to access a field so that you can access it directly (.). Why not just access by pointer (->).[/quote]because i got used to java and visualbasic, so i like the . operator, also a -> is twice as much typing effort (lol)

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jython wrote:

I wrote an RSC server with this guy named Henry.Jekyll or OneWhoSighs :[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2009, 08:09:01 pm[/size][hr]BTW, http://beej.us/guide/bgnet/examples/selectserver.c I looked at that code when I wrote my server as well :|[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2009, 08:12:07 pm[/size][hr]BTW 2: Why do you dereference a pointer each time you want to access a field so that you can access it directly (.). Why not just access by pointer (->).
